Title: Estimation of breathing rate from respiratory sinus arrhythmia: comparison of various methods
Notes:
The paper does not describe a respiratory extraction method based on photoplethysmography (PPG) or motion signals. Rather, the paper evaluates different methods for estimating the mean respiratory rate from heart rate variability (HRV) data, specifically the respiratory sinus arrhythmia (RSA) component of HRV.

The methods investigated in the paper are:

1. Spectral analysis methods:
- Fourier Transform (Spec-FT)
- Autoregressive modeling (Spec-AR)

2. Autocorrelation function based methods:
- Simple method (ACF-max)
- Advanced method (ACF-adv)

3. Counting methods:
- Original method (Count-orig)
- Advanced counting method (Count-adv)

The authors compare the performance of these different methods in estimating the respiratory rate from both respiratory signals and HRV/RSA data. They find that the counting methods, especially the advanced counting method (Count-adv), provide the best estimates of the respiratory rate from the HRV data.
